author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Currently, the [WriteValueToFile()](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/75ba74cce6164d46bb85f561b4d657a56f1431f2/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/PSConfiguration.cs#L491) method always writes to the config file even if the value didn't change.  We could add logic to check if the value has changed before writing to the file.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: That means `WriteValueToFile()` need to read the data and do the comparison, which possibly has already done by the code calling `WriteValueToFile`. If it's a scenario that we care to skip a write when the value is the same, such as experimental feature changes, I think the check should happen before calling `WriteValueToFile`.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This was addressed in #8318 agreeing to check before calling `WriteValueToFile()`

title: In PSConfiguration.cs, WriteValueToFile() should check if value has changed before writing
